meanings.definition: To have as a purpose or intention.
meanings.sent1: She meaned to finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: He always meaned well, even if he made mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The cat meaned to catch the mouse, but got distracted by a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile meaned gratitude and joy.
meanings.sent5: His determined look meaned he was ready to face any challenge.

meanings.sent2: His silence meaned he was deep in thought.
meanings.sent3: The loud thunder meaned a storm was coming.
meanings.sent4: Her tears meaned she was overwhelmed with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The flag at half-mast meaned a day of mourning.

meanings.definition: To calculate the average of a set of numbers.
meanings.sent1: She meaned the test scores to find the class average.
meanings.sent2: The students meaned the data to analyze the results.
meanings.sent3: The calculator meaned the numbers quickly and accurately.
meanings.sent4: His math skills meaned he could easily find the mean.
meanings.sent5: The statistician meaned the data to draw meaningful conclusions.
